msItem.locus: Passages distributed between texts I-1, I-2 and I-3 (fols. 3r-166v).
msItem.title: VI) Mäzmurä dǝngǝl “Psalter of the Virgin”
msItem.rubric:
Nomina sacra (name of St. Mary in Texts I-4, I-5 and I-6); titles and numbers of the Pss., Canticles and Songs; incipit of the Pss. of the Virgin; letters ይ, ር and ዎ in the word ይባርክዎ and letters ስ and ሕ in the word ስቡሕኒ in Canticle 10; a few words in Text I-4; name of the Hebrew letters of Ps. 118; words ነዓብየኪ and ብርክት in Text I-4; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
A few lines (alternating with black lines) on the incipit page of Text I-1.

div.span: [Fol. 3r]: Come to me, David, the King of Israel,
Master of beautiful psalms and sweet of voice.
Give me understanding of all the parables and interpretation thereof,
So that I may praise the Virgin Mary,
ዘተመነይኩ፡ ሀብኒ፡ ወዘኃሠሥኩ፡ በማኅሌት፡ ወበመዝሙር፡ ስመ፡ ዚአኪ፡ ነገርኩ፨
[Fol. 166r]: For your sake, Mary, the sun rises.
The wing of your love is a wing of burning fire
While they are sustained by each of the fingers (?).
Give me that which I long for and which I seek. In song and in psalmody will I speak out your name
And the work which you have entrusted me with I have accomplished.

msItem.title: V) ʾAnqäṣä bǝrhan “Gate of Light”
msItem.rubric:
Nomina sacra (name of St. Mary in Texts I-4, I-5 and I-6); titles and numbers of the Pss., Canticles and Songs; incipit of the Pss. of the Virgin; letters ይ, ር and ዎ in the word ይባርክዎ and letters ስ and ሕ in the word ስቡሕኒ in Canticle 10; a few words in Text I-4; name of the Hebrew letters of Ps. 118; words ነዓብየኪ and ብርክት in Text I-4; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
A few lines (alternating with black lines) on the incipit page of Text I-1.

div.span: ክብርት፡ ወልዕልት፡ ብርሃን፡ ማዕርገ፡ ሕይወት፡ ወማኅደረ፡ መለኮት፡ ቅድስተ፡ ቅዱሳን፡ አንቲ፡ ውእቱ፡

p.span: [Fol. 174vb]: The holy one and the blessed one, the praised and the happy one, the glorious and the exalted one, the [gate of] light, the ladder of life and the abode of the Divinity, the Holy of Holies you are…

div.span: ይጸግወነ፡ ሣህሎ፡ ወምሕረቶ፡ ይስረይ፡ ኃጢአተነ፡ በብዝኃ፡ ምሕረቱ፡ ስብሐት፡ ለኪ፡ ኦወላዲተ፡ እግዚአ፡ ኲሉ፡
አኰቴት፡ ወክብር፡ ለአብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ይእዜኒ፡ ወዘልፈኒ፡ ወለዓለመ፡ ዓለም።

p.span: [Fol. 178ra]: May He bestow upon us His benevolence and His mercy, may He forgive our sins in His abounding mercy. Praise be to you, o Mother of the Lord of all! Praise and glory be to the Father, the Son and the Holy Spirit, now and forever and unto the ages of ages.

listBibl.bibl: Uppsala O Etiop. 1 (16th cent.), fols. 252r-260v (LöfUpp 32, n°4);
BritMus Orient. 12467 (1660), fols. 161v-166r (StrBritLib 23, n°17 [s. also nos. 18-25]);
JRyM Ethiopian 5 (18th cent.), fols. 158rb-163vb (StrJRyM 7-9, no. 5 and pl. 8).

msItem.title: IV) Wǝddase Maryam “Praise of Mary”
msItem.rubric:
Nomina sacra (name of St. Mary in Texts I-4, I-5 and I-6); titles and numbers of the Pss., Canticles and Songs; incipit of the Pss. of the Virgin; letters ይ, ር and ዎ in the word ይባርክዎ and letters ስ and ሕ in the word ስቡሕኒ in Canticle 10; a few words in Text I-4; name of the Hebrew letters of Ps. 118; words ነዓብየኪ and ብርክት in Text I-4; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
A few lines (alternating with black lines) on the incipit page of Text I-1.

div.span: እግዚእ፡ ያግዕዞ፡ ለአዳም፡ ኅዙነ፡ ወትኩዘ፡ ልብ፡ ወያግብኦ፡ ኀበ፡ ዘትካት፡ መንበሩ። ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት።

p.span: [Fol. 166va]: The Lord [wished] to liberate Adam, sad and aggrieved at heart, and restore him to his throne of old. Pray for us, o Holy One!

div.span: ይጸግወነ፡ ሣህሎ፡ ወምሕረቶ፡ ይስረይ፡ ኃጢአተነ፡ በብዝኃ፡ ምሕረቱ። ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት።

p.span: [Fol. 174va]: May He bestow upon us His benevolence and His mercy, may He forgive our sins in His abounding mercy. Pray for us, o Holy One!

listBibl.bibl: Uppsala O Etiop. 1 (16th cent.), fols. 231-251 (LöfUpp 32, n°4);
BritMus Orient. 12467 (1660), fols. 152r-161v (StrBritLib 23, n°17 [s. also nos. 18-25]);
JRyM Ethiopian 5 (18th cent.), fols. 146ra-158rb (StrJRyM 7-9, no. 5 and pl. 8).

note.span: The book begins with the portion to be read on Monday. The beginning words of the daily portions for Tuesday, Thursday and Friday are written in red without the name of the day being overtly given (fols. 167rb, l.12; 170ra, l.19; 171vb, l.17). For the Wednesday portion (fol. 168vb, l.2), the name of the day is written in pencil in the upper margin. The portions for Saturday and Sunday are only separated from the previous text by wider spaces.

msItem.title: III) Mäḥalǝyä mäḥalǝy ‟Song of Songs”
msItem.rubric:
Nomina sacra (name of St. Mary in Texts I-4, I-5 and I-6); titles and numbers of the Pss., Canticles and Songs; incipit of the Pss. of the Virgin; letters ይ, ር and ዎ in the word ይባርክዎ and letters ስ and ሕ in the word ስቡሕኒ in Canticle 10; a few words in Text I-4; name of the Hebrew letters of Ps. 118; words ነዓብየኪ and ብርክት in Text I-4; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
A few lines (alternating with black lines) on the incipit page of Text I-1.

div.span: [Fol. 159v]: The Song of Songs of Solomon.
Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth;
your breasts are better than wine.
ጕይ፡ አንተ፡ ወልድ፡ እኁየ፡ ወተመሰላ፡ ለወይጠል።
ወእመ፡ አኮ፡ ከመ፡ ወሬዛ፡ ኃየል፡ ውስተ፡ አድባረ፡ ድኁኃን።
ዘተመነይኩ፡ ሀብኒ፡ ወዘኃሠሥኩ፡ በማኅሌት፡ ወበመዝሙር፡ ስመ፡ ዚአኪ፡ ነገርኩ፨
For your sake, Mary, the sun rises.
The wing of your love is a wing of burning fire
While they are sustained by each of the fingers (?).
Give me that which I long for and which I seek. In song and in psalmody will I speak out your name
And the work which you have entrusted me with I have accomplished.

listBibl.bibl: Uppsala O Etiop. 1 (16th cent.), fols. 193v-212r (LöfUpp 31, n°4);
BritMus Orient. 12467 (1660), fols. 129v-142v (StrBritLib 22, n°17 [s. also nos. 18-25]);
JRyM Ethiopian 5 (18th cent.), fols. 139r-146r (StrJRyM 7-9, no. 5 and pl. 8)

note.span: After Song 3 (starting from fol. 162r), the chapter numbering is discontinued.

msItem.title: II) Mäḥalǝyä näbiyat "The Canticles of the Prophets"
msItem.rubric:
Nomina sacra (name of St. Mary in Texts I-4, I-5 and I-6); titles and numbers of the Pss., Canticles and Songs; incipit of the Pss. of the Virgin; letters ይ, ር and ዎ in the word ይባርክዎ and letters ስ and ሕ in the word ስቡሕኒ in Canticle 10; a few words in Text I-4; name of the Hebrew letters of Ps. 118; words ነዓብየኪ and ብርክት in Text I-4; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
A few lines (alternating with black lines) on the incipit page of Text I-1.

p.style: text-align: justify; line-height: 12pt; font-family: Arial; margin-bottom: 0pt;

div.style: text-align: justify; line-height: 12pt; font-family: Arial; margin-bottom: 0pt;
text-align: justify; line-height: 12pt; font-family: Arial; margin-bottom: 0pt;

div.span: [Fol. 145r]: The Canticles of the Prophets and the prayer of Moses.
Let us exalt God the Exalted who is exalted.
The horse and his rider He has thrown into the sea.
[Fol. 159v]: … so that you open the light for the Gentiles and the glory of your people Israel.
Do not, O Mary, despise your servant now,
Before I reach the time of old age.
O compassionate and full of mercy like a river!
Since I am overpowered and overridden with despondency –
When shall I find what I hope for?

listBibl.bibl: Uppsala O Etiop. 1 (16th cent.), fols. 193v-212r (LöfUpp 31, n°4);
BritMus Orient. 12467 (1660), fols. 129v-142v (StrBritLib 22, n°17 [s. also nos. 18-25]);
JRyM Ethiopian 5 (18th cent.), fols. 126r-138v (StrJRyM 7-9, no. 5 and pl. 8).

msItem.title: I. Dawit "Psalter"
msItem.rubric:
Nomina sacra (name of St. Mary in Texts I-4, I-5 and I-6); titles and numbers of the Pss., Canticles and Songs; incipit of the Pss. of the Virgin; letters ይ, ር and ዎ in the word ይባርክዎ and letters ስ and ሕ in the word ስቡሕኒ in Canticle 10; a few words in Text I-4; name of the Hebrew letters of Ps. 118; words ነዓብየኪ and ብርክት in Text I-4; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
A few lines (alternating with black lines) on the incipit page of Text I-1.

msItem.title: I) Mäzmurä Dawit “Psalms of David”
msItem.rubric:
Nomina sacra (name of St. Mary in Texts I-4, I-5 and I-6); titles and numbers of the Pss., Canticles and Songs; incipit of the Pss. of the Virgin; letters ይ, ር and ዎ in the word ይባርክዎ and letters ስ and ሕ in the word ስቡሕኒ in Canticle 10; a few words in Text I-4; name of the Hebrew letters of Ps. 118; words ነዓብየኪ and ብርክት in Text I-4; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
A few lines (alternating with black lines) on the incipit page of Text I-1.

div.span: ተግሣጽ፡ ለኲሉ፡ ፍካሬ፡ ዘጻድቃን፡ ወዘኃጥአን፡ መዝሙር፡ ዘዳዊት።
፩፡ ሃ፡ ብፁዕ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘኢሖረ፡ በምክረ፡ ረሲዓን፨
[Fol. 3r]: Come to me, David, the King of Israel,
Master of beautiful psalms and sweet of voice.
Give me understanding of all the parables and interpretation thereof,
So that I may praise the Virgin Mary,
Instruction in every interpretation of the righteous and the sinful, Psalter of David. Hallelujah.

div.style: margin: auto auto 0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;
margin: auto auto 0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;
margin: auto auto 0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;
margin: auto auto 0pt; text-align: justify; line-height: normal;

listBibl.bibl: Uppsala O Etiop. 1 (16th cent.), fols. 1r-193r (LöfUpp 31, no. 4);
BritMus Orient. 12467 (1660), fols. 8r-129r (StrBritLib 22, no. 17 [s. also nos. 18-25]);
JRyM Ethiopian 5 (18th cent.), fols. 4r-126r (StrJRyM 7-9, no. 5 and pl. 8)

note.span: Ps. 118 has the following structure: the name of each letter of the Hebrew alphabet is written in red and followed by a short acronymic definition (written also in red) linking it to one or another property of God (of the type:

, fol. 117r). Then follows the text of the corresponding part of the Psalm, preceded by its number in red and the name of the Hebrew letter repeated in black. Every such part of Ps. 118 is followed by a short poem from Mäzmurä dǝngǝl, the first line of which is written in red.

list.item: 8 ፲X(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 74r-81v)

supportDesc.condition: The Ms. is worn and stained with wax. The original reddish-brown tooled leather cover is for the most part missing. The brown leather cover is damaged. Leaves of quire A are of smaller size (mutilated at the bottom). Holes are amended: fols. 48, 57, 64, 128, 130, 132, 160.

layout.note: Texts I-1, I-2, I-3: all data for fol. 4r.
layout.ab: Ruling and pricking are mostly visible.
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

layout.note: Texts I-4, I-5: all data for fol. 167r.
layout.ab: Ruling and pricking are mostly visible.
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.
The A-type lines extend not from upper edge to lower edge of the folio, but from upper primary prick to lower primary prick.

list.item: Four dot asterisk in red (for the titles of the Psalms), or in black (in the second part of the Song of Songs, in the “Praise of Mary” and the “Gate of Light”).
III. Chain of black and red dots (marks the end of the first ten-psalm section, fol. 11r)

handDesc.handNote:
Mediocre Black, red Kǝnfä RufaʾelKǝnfä Rufaʾel (?) (s. Additio 3).Late 17th - early 18th century (?)
ሃ፡ for ሃሌ፡ ሉያ፡ (e.g., fol. 3r, l.7)
ስ᎓/ስቡ᎓/ ስቡሕfor ስቡሕኒ᎓ ውእቱ᎓ ወልዑልኒ᎓ ውእቱ᎓ ለዓለም᎓ (Canticle 10, fols. 154v-155v)
ሰ፡ or ሰ፡ ቅ፡ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት። (e.g., fol. 168vb, l.19; fol. 170ra, l.4)
ወ፡ ሣ፡ ይ፡ ሰ፡ ቅ፡ for ወልድኪ፡ ሣህሎ፡ ይክፍለነ። ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት። (e.g., fol. 177va, l.17)
quires XI-XII; probably the same hand which executed Additiones 1 and 2.

decoDesc.decoNote: - Fol. 3r (implicit of Text I-1): Simple coloured ornamental band (geometric motifs).
- Fol. 73v: Short coloured (red) ornamental band (geometric motifs).
- Fol. 95v (explicit of Text I-1): Simple coloured (red, black) ornamental band (geometric motifs).
- Fol. 144r: Simple coloured (red) ornamental band (geometric motifs).
- Fol. 145r: Simple coloured (red) ornamental band (geometric motifs).

span.span: Fol. 95v: Salutation to St. ˀabunä Zärˀaburuk (Zärˀa Buruk).

div.span: አመ፡ በውስተ፡ እድ፡ ትባርክ፡ ድራረ፡ ኅብስት፡
እስመ፡ ዘርአቡሩክ፡ ንበጽሕ፡ ንቤሎ፡ ከመ፡ እብነ፡ አድማስ፡ ፍጡነ፡ አስናነ፡ ነደ፡ ብርት፡ ሌዋታን፡ በከመ፡ መጠነ፡ ለለወርኁ፡ ታየድዓነ።
እስከ፡ ኈልቈ፡ ፻ ትውልድ፡ እምህር፡ ለከ፡

item.p: The text is written in hand b (s. also Additio 2). A few spaces are left unfilled.

span.span: Fol. 144v: Sälam-hymn to an angel (St. Michael?).

div.span: ሰላም፡ ለከ፡ ተፈኒወከ፡ በኃይል፡ እም፡ ድንግል፡

item.p: The text is written in hand b (s. also Additio 1). A few spaces are left unfilled.

p.span: Fol. 178rb, l.1-5: Short supplication to God for the commissioner of the manuscript (?) and the scribe.

span.span: በአምላከ፡ ዳዊት፡ ተማኅፀንኩ፡ አድኅኖ፡ ለገብርከ፡ ተክለ፡ ሃይ

item.p: The note is written in hand b, in red. It is partly unreadable. It mentions Täklä Haymanot and the scribe Kǝnfä Rufaʾel.

p.span: Fol. 178rb, l. 6-21: Supplication to St. Mary and God.

div.span: ስብሐት፡ ለአብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ለዓለም፡ ወለዓለም።
ዓለም፡ ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት፡ ድንግል፡ ማርያም፡
ሰአ፡ ለነ፡ ዳዊት፡ ቅድመ፡ መንበሩ፡ ለፀባኦት፡
ኦአምላከ፡ ዳዊት፡ ዕቀብ፡ ሕይወቶሙ፡ ወሥረይ፡ ኃጢአቶሙ፡ ለእለ፡ ወለዱነ፡ በሥጋ፡ ወለዕለ፡ ወለዱነ፡ በመንፈስ፡ ኅቡረ፡ መሐሮሙ፡ መሐረነ፡ በመንግሥተ፡ ሰማያት። ዝዳ<...>

item.p: The last line of the note is washed out.

list.item: - The mid point of the “Psalms of David” (in Ps. 77) is marked on fol. 73v. - After Ps. 115, to the right of the Marian poem, two other short poems are written in the margin, in smaller script: the first one dedicated to God and the second one to Mary, with opening lines in red: fol. 113r. - Omitted letters, words or passages are written interlineally: fols. 8v, 16r, 22v, 25r, 29v, 30v, 32r, 34v, 37v, 38r, 44v, 45r, 49v, 53v, 73v, 87r, 128v, 137v, 139r, 154v, 158r, 161r, 161v, 162r, 163r, 163v, 165r, 166r. - Numerous spaces for rubrication are left unfilled in Texts I-4 and I-5. - Part of the line is taken up: fols. 11v, 54v, 64r, 64v, 64r, 69v, 71r, 71v, 74v, 75r, 77r, 80v, 126r, 146r, 153v. - Part of the line is taken down: fol. 98v. - Pen trial: fol. 179r. - Writing exercises (letters of the Ethiopic syllabary): fols. 1r-3r. - Scribbles, doodles: fols. 2r, 3v, 8rv, 19v, 73r, 97r, 102v, 143v-144v, 169v, 171v, 178v-180v.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with tooled reddish-brown cover (for the most part missing); remains of textile inlays. Overback made of brown untooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.
Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover. Parchment guard is attached to quire VIII by means of side-stitches.

origin.origDate: Mid-17th - mid-18th century (or os still somewhat earlier period).

listBibl.bibl: Ms. previously unknown.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
